summary: This bill, the Protecting Federal Funds from Human Trafficking and Smuggling Act of 2025, aims to prevent the misuse of federal funds by non-profit entities involved in human trafficking or alien smuggling. It mandates that non-profits receiving federal funds certify compliance with relevant laws and prohibits funds for non-compliant entities. It also denies tax exemptions to non-compliant organizations, requires the Department of Homeland Security to develop strategies and publish information, and mandates reports from the Comptroller General. The bill amends existing law related to verification requirements for nonprofit charitable organizations.
